pros: Great family values, and a place to be
cons: nothing yet! Will let you know

pros: Great people at the ground level
cons: CEO is a "numbers guy" who is in the process of taking over from his father. That should tell you all you need to know.

pros: The people are really great. The company does nice things for you like shirts, meals, etc.
cons: Takes too long for things to happen. Some of the people who have been there forever are just coasting.
advice_to_mgmt: Get more involved with your people and actually learn what they are doing. Don't just take them for granted.

review_title: I was an intern in the apparel team. I learned a lot about production, and everyone was so nice and helpful!
years_at_company: I was an intern in the apparel team. I learned a lot about production, and everyone was so nice and helpful!
pros: Everything I learned here was a great learning experience. Internships like this are very rare in the Chicago area! It helped me through interviews and get a job right away in the fashion industry after I graduated!
cons: No cons. I miss the place very much.

pros: Easy work, safety is always put first, time goes by fairly quick, not much past related skills needed, inventory is easy to memorize
cons: Both upper and warehouse management can be very condescending, everything needs to be done a certain way or else you get yelled at
advice_to_mgmt: Be a little more understanding of the workers' situations, don't talk down to anyone for little things, respect the longer tenured workers a little more because they've put up with a lot over the years

pros: The company is a growing and dynamic company in what can be a slow to change industry. The company also operates with values (integrity driven customer first attitude) in how it's works with its customers employees and partners.
cons: A challenge & opportunity: educating the americanpublic about what we can do for athletes, teams and leagues.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the aggressive efforts to grow and change!

pros: I've been with the company a year now and its the best career move I've ever made. The CEO and Management staff are very friendly. It's a very energetic company with many opportunities to advance. If you love sports and want a great career, this is definitely the company to do it with.
cons: Must like pizza... there's tons of it! :)
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what your doing... it's working!

pros: I've been with Champro for ten years now and it has been fast-paced and fun. I've been promoted several times during which time the company has tripled in size. We are encouraged to continuously find ways to improve, which has been a fun challenge for me.
cons: Some former employees have blamed others when they couldn't keep pace with the change. It's disappointing to hear people take their frustrations out on others.
advice_to_mgmt: Thanks for picking up such a big chunk of the health care tab!

pros: Working for a family owned company allows me to work directly with upper management/owners on a daily bases. Suggestions, comments and feedback are encouraged. Your voice matters.
cons: Commute. Perhaps adding Metra passes as an employee benefit?!?!
advice_to_mgmt: Continue taking care of your people and evolving with the industry.

pros: Mid sized company in an industry with very large companies but very professional in their approach
cons: Requires high energy people and commitment to excellence
advice_to_mgmt: Push employees to get the most from them. Keep pushing to surpass larger much competitors and grow market share with national accounts.
